name: Marriott Aruba Resort & Stellaris Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Went there for a weekend to celebrate a birthday
reviews.title: Good Enough!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Good hotel, good check in, bellmen are prepared to take care of you and show you where to check in. Its about a 15 to 20 minute ride from the airport.
reviews.title: DIVAS ON DECK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach is really nice, breakfast is very good. I am a Gold member and you only get a 10% at the buffet, you do not get free breakfast, like I have received in other Marriotts. Rooms are averaged sized and they look like they got some work done in the past couple of years. Air conditioning is not great, and being in the beach I had a bit of problems with that but it was not as bad.
reviews.title: Amazing Honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ruth Chris is good as usual, strange its inside a hotel, but I enjoyed it! Casino is not that big but has enough good tables to have a good time. Service in the beach is very good. You have enough places to eat inside your hotel.
reviews.title: Unbelievable Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: They are building a Ritz next door, would definitely try that when its ready!
reviews.title: La Vista Restaurant at Marriot Stellaris Aruba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the fifth floor of the south wing, facing south. The room and balcony was spacious and impeccably clean. The maids did a good job each day, and left extra towels for us, as we requested. The bed was comfortable—we were a bit apprehensive because we have had deplorable experiences with other hotels that have the temperpedic-type mattresses. This must be a different type of foam. The carpet really should be replaced, otherwise, the room looked new.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, we heard the previously referenced constant drone of the giant exhaust fan which evidently pulls the air through the entire hotel, and vents it out the exhaust, but the noise wasn’t overly obnoxious. The rooms have good sound-deadening qualities, because, although we heard some loud, drunken neighboring guests when they were in the hallway in the wee hours of the morning, we heard very little of them in their room. So, in the course of an ordinary stay at this hotel, with regular, quiet, or reasonably quiet guests as your neighbors, you probably won’t hear anything from the rooms above, below or adjacent to your room.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had no trouble getting a palapa—if one of us went to stand in line before 4 p.m. the day before, or before 7 a.m. for that day. But then again, the weather was not particularly ideal during some of our stay. The hotel does a poor job communicating how its palapa system works, and people tended to be confused and sometimes incorrectly put their chairs at a palapa that was reserved for someone else. The Marriott should consider putting an instruction page in the little packet with the room keys that the guest receives when checking in.
reviews.title: Nice stay---would return to Tradewinds floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was disappointing that so many guests lit up their cigars and cigarettes in the palapa area. One reason we selected the Marriott was because of its strict non-smoking policy. If you are sensitive to, or simply hate smoke, beware that this could be a problem for you. The Marriott should really look into a method of creating a small palapa area for smokers, and leaving most of the palapa area as smoke free. I suspect that they can’t outrightly declare one area of the beach sand as smoke-free because it is probably publicly owned. However, perhaps they could do it a different way---If someone wants to reserve a palapa, or sit on a Marriott-owned chair, or obtain a Marriott-owned beach towel, then the hotel guests would need to abide by the smoking and non-smoking rules that the Marriott would create if they want to sit on a Marriott-owned chair.
reviews.title: Great honeymoon experience on an awesome island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The concierge desk seemed to be staffed by salespeople for a particular tour operator, and provided no assistance for us.
reviews.title: Lot of room for improving

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: We just returned back tonight after an amazing week at this hotel! This was our second year back and we love it here. This hotel is just beautiful! The property is so beautiful with the waterfalls and landscape. My daughter who is almost two would wake up every morning and the first word would be wow. She was so happy on the beach and in the pool. This hotel exceeds our expectations year after year. On our first day of arrival we received champagne and choc covered strawberries for our anniversary and since my daughter is almost two they gave her a plate of choc chip cookies. We were so excited to receive that gift from the management. We can't wait to return again next September:)
reviews.title: Another great family vacation at this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights for our honeymoon is August 2013. The service was great. We requested an upgrade and they were able to upgrade our room the next day. There was construction going on the hotel next-door for the Ritz Carlton but we didn't hear any noise. Our room faced the adult pool, so we had no view of construction. The beach is clean and there are plenty of chairs and umbrellas to go around. We were always able to find a chair at the beach or pool no matter what time of the day it was. The sunset is beautiful. Aruba is very safe. The hotel is located walking distance to restaurants and bars. We walked everywhere and we were satisfied with all the restaurants. The rooms are very clean and there were plenty of towels. The service was excellent.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge desk helped us with restaurant recommendations and reservations and they were always very helpful. We would definitely revisit. I mentioned that I was a Marriott rewards member and they waived the Wi-Fi fee so we had complementary Wi-Fi during our stay. Wi-Fi was available throughout the hotel and in the room.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at Marriott
Totally Awesome
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from our first stay in Aruba at the Marriott. Being elite members, we Are very loyal to Marriott and had high expectations - which were met above and beyond! We were greeted at the front desk with a welcome bag and were able to check in at 12:30 upon arrival. Our garden view room had a great view of the pool and ocean in the distance. The ocean water was crystal clear and the sand white as snow. The swim up bar in the pool was so much fun and most of the bars had happy hour specials daily which helped to save a few dollars. The lobby cafe had breakfast sandwiches fruit pastries sandwiches salads and gelato - very reasonably priced too. As an elite member, we received a discount card to use at the restaurants. Simply Fish was excellent - the food was delicious and the staff was so accommodating and polite. The hotel staff was very welcoming and always had a smile on their face and greeted us with a big hello. We met many couples and groups of friends who were on their 5th 6th or 7th trip back to the Marriott. My husband and I are already looking forward to returning next year. The weather was great all week, minus a few showers which only lasted for about a half hour each time. The beach hotel and pool was not crowded at all. Many guests said they always return in September or October to avoid crowds and get good room rates. Thank you Marriott as always for an incredible stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just arrived at the hotel and are blown away with its beauty, excellent service, views, room upgrade and friendly staff....Maria, Margaret, Kimesha, and Glendy. We dont want to leave as planned, we want to stay longer!
reviews.title: Second stay, still a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone at this hotel, from the front desk to the maintenance workers were very friendly and helpful. You can expect a smile and hello from just about everybody. It really is one happy island.
reviews.title: great hotel and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted with a nice glass of juice upon arrival and check in went smooth. We asked if any upgrades were available for rewards members, but the hotel was full. The room was very spacious and our partial oceanview had a great view of the pool and ocean. Sunsets were incredible each night. The grounds were well kept, small lizards are on the resort and iguanas hang by the pools.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked a day trip to Curacao, but found out at the airport that DAE airlines had gone bankrupt the week before. (doh!) When we returned to the hotel, the front desk made numerous calls to the airlines on our behalf, but to no avail. Lost $200. Be careful with small airlines. Points to the hotel for the help.
reviews.title: Outstanding Island. LOVED IT.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had no issues getting a palapa on the beach, some are reserved, some are not I guess. Find one without a reserved sign and enjoy. We did see people moving people's stuff and that's not cool.
reviews.title: Excellend as we expected!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative, it was our 2 year anniversary. We noted this when our reservation was made and told anyone who asked, (bellboy, rewards desk) and we did not receive any acknowledgement from the hotel. While not a big deal, we read other reviews where people were showered with gifts. This is a big hotel, but the response should be the same for everyone.
reviews.title: Tradewinds Club Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to celebrate our 30th anniversary, opted for the Tradewinds Club and have absolutely no complaints. The hotel staff went way out of their way with personal notes, cards, gifts, etc. to help us celebrate. The room was more than we hoped for. The view is hard to beat. The food, fantastic! The separate beach area for Tradewinds was less crowded and quieter. Most of the people we met had been going there for years and plan to keep the tradition going for the foreseeable future. The hotel is located right near just about any and everything you would want; shops, restaurants, movie theaters, etc. The ladies at Tradewinds, Maria, Margaret, Kimesha, Harshita, Glendy and the others are professional and fun! If you haven't figured it out we loved our Tradewinds experience and would highly recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Exceeds expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: What can I say? I am a former Marriott employee & a current Marriott rewards member so when I checked in the hotel, i expected them to live up to their standards and I was not disappointed. My room was facing the construction site, but that's not a complaint because i knew that when I booked the room. Hey, I didn't go to Aruba to look out of my window, I went to enjoy the island. The hotel was on the beach. I could literally leave my room and be floating in the Caribbean Sea withing 5 mins. Everyone from the front desk to the bell hops to the bartenders to the room service staff were so pleasant. The food was amazing. I felt like I was at a 5 star restaurant. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to Aruba.
reviews.title: You can never go wrong with Marriott!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd never been to Aruba and had no idea what to expect. We booked our stay 3 weeks piror to our departure date and we weren't sure about what type of accommodation we might be in for. To say our stay was wonderful would be an understatement... we had a lovely view of the garden and the ocean in the distance. The pools, beach, room, casino, food options were all fantastic. The only comment (not complaint) was the way you have to reserve a tiki hut on the beach. I am an early riser, so it wasn't a problem...but you need to out to the beach in the dark early morning hours to get in line for the chance to reserve a hut. There must be a better way!
reviews.title: Great Mid-Winter getaway vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely will be back and recommend this resort.
reviews.title: Great for a Couples get away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: This property was great. Alll of the staff was super helpful. They seemed to always be smiling and ALWAYS greeted us warmly.
reviews.title: Best Vacation of my life!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: marriott stellaris is always consistent have been coming many years and always taken care of, the beach side towel service is my favorite they always make sure we have chairs set up where we need them...tip them and they will take care of u too. brian and francis at the bar make a good slippery monkey, but im a gambler and i do think this is best casino on island. most tables ive seen, and i hit up the hyatt . miss the craps tables but do enjoy seeing luuvy at the tables, she still remembers your name and your drink and thats service. will always comeback to stellaris but i will checkout the ritz
reviews.title: best hotel on the island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: The Marriott Stelaris is the perfect hotel if you are looking for a hip, yet family-oriented hotel!!!! This hotel is great for EVERYONE! No matter what level member you are, you still get treated like you're in first class! Besides the service being great, the beach is kept so beautiful-they're are no advertisers trying to sell you stuff! The hotel is in a great location as well! Stay here the next time you visit Aruba!
reviews.title: The Royal Treatment -Excellent Service & Beautiful Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful facility. I highly recommend upgrading to the Tradewinds Club level which includes meals throughout the day and an open bar in the evening as wel as other benefits. The beach was well maintained and not too crowded.
reviews.title: Thoroughly Enjoyed Our 4 Night Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I was given a junior suite overlooknig the pool to the side and ocean to the front. It was a very nicely appointed room and very spacious. The service att he front desk was great and the rest of the staff at the bars and restaurants all had that "Wanting to help" attitude rather than "Having to help!" My only compaint was the fact that the last night I was woken up all night long by revellers in the pool and also by the occupants of the room next to mine, where some very loud, drunk ladies were discussing how much they were going to win in the casino downstairs. Take away the casino and this would be a perfect hotel!
reviews.title: Loved my stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I greatly enjoyed our stay at this hotel in August. The hotel is very clean, restaurants are good and the staff is helpful. Although they were a bit pushy with their "Marriot Vacation Club" which at times made interactions with staff awkward, we really enjoyed it here. The adults only pool is a must, but get down early to get a seat. Also, be sure to reapply the sunscreen frequently in Aruba! Those tradewinds can trick you into thinking you don't need more!!!!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: Visited Aruba many times staying at several of the Marriott hotels. So so beach location but the island and ita wonderful people make up for any of those issues. Great restaurants. Love the Mariott properties and plan to visit many more times in the future!!!
reviews.title: One Happy Island!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: For our first time visit to Aruba, we decided to stay at Marriott Aruba Resort & Stellaris Casino. Our experience with this hotel was excellent, because
reviews.title: Marriott Aruba Resort & Stellaris Casino - excellent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: - All staff is very friendly and tries to help in any possible way
reviews.title: Excellent relaxing stay great service excellent room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Our room was big and the bed was comfortable (we had a partial ocean view room with a big balcony on the 5th floor)
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel and experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - The room was very clean (Cleaning Maid visited our room 2 times a day)
reviews.title: 40th Birthday Getway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Aruba the week of Labor Day. Upon arrival we were greeted well by the hotel staff. We had left our wallet in the cab and within the hour, the hotel staff had located the cab driver and our wallet was returned in tact. Kudos to the quick action of the staff, Jose, Frank, and Pedro. It could have been the start to a bad location. The rooms were spacious and we were located at the end of the hall which gave us an awesome view of the beach. Thanks Julissa for giving us a great room. The staff was exceptionally helpful. They catered to all our needs. We stayed at the adult pool which seems to cater to couples. The beach was great, too...definitely go jet skiing. Daily breakfast hotel was great; a great start to the day. Lunch by the pool was great. Kudos to Miro who treated us like royalty. The gym was well appointed and the staff was very attentive. The Marriot is very interested in signing you up for Marriott Vacation Club, so be prepared for the sales pitch.
reviews.title: Exceptional Service, Exceptional Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: We liked this Marriott. The staff was great. Every single person we encountered was nice and helpful.
reviews.title: Trade winds floor is a good deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: This is a 6 star Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trade winds floor is a good deal. Breakfast, lunch, tea and appetizers are included in the lounge with an open bar from 6-9. Appetizers are enough food that you could skip dinner if you were having a lazy day.
reviews.title: one of our favorite hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons:
reviews.title: Simply amazing

aka: Marriott Aruba Resort And Stellaris Casino
description: Aruba Marriott's adults only pool H20asis
